channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NH

item.title: Report X-2023030641
item.description:
Report X-2023030641

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-26T00:34:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-08
  • City: LONDONDERRY
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA actively leaking from the unload. A safety specialist was notified of the leak, and made sure it was placed in the appropriate bin for processing. DescribePack: The cap was observed to be loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the appropriate with bin and brought to QA.

item.title: Report E-2023020173
item.description:
Report E-2023020173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-26T00:34:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-07
  • City: MANCHESTER
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XNH experienced a release of Barium Nitrate from (3) 10-pound poly bags. ERTS dispatched contractors to complete cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1.5-cups of product released to the concrete dock floor and a 3' x 3' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bags and released product were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023020134
item.description:
Report X-2023020134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-26T00:34:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-02
  • City: LONDONDERRY
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE HANDLING, THE CHARACTERISTIC RATTLE SOUND PRODUCED BY DRY ICE WAS HEARD. RESPONDER OPENED PACKAGE TO FIND FOUR PINTS OF ICE CREAM BEING COOLED BY APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED. OUTER BOX IS A THERMO CHILL INSULATED BOX IMPRINTED WITH RUSH, PERISHABLE, AND UP ARROWS. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM VT USING UPS ACCOUNT 517AW3, UNILEVER - BJ BURLINGTON, 30 COMMUNITY DRIVE, SUITE 1, SOUTH BURLINGTON VT 05403.

item.description:

  • City: NASHUA

  • Description: DURING LOCAL SORT PACKAGE IT WAS DISCOVERED PACKAGE CONTAINED SEVERAL SMALL BOXES OF NEW AMMUNITION WHEN BOTTOM OF PACKAGE OPENED. UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED EXTERIOR OF PACKAGE HAD NO MARKINGS TO INDICATE IT CONTAINED AMMUNITION NOR DID IT HAVE THE REQUIRED LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND LABEL FOR PACKAGES CONTAINING AMMUNITION.

item.title: Report X-2023010119
item.description:
Report X-2023010119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-25T21:08:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-30
  • City: NASHUA
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WITH NON-FLAMMABLE DIAMOND HAZMAT LABEL DISCOVERED ON OUTBOUND BELT LEAKING. BELT STOPPED AND DESIGNATED RESPONDERS ALERTED. NO AIR ACTIVELY BEING DISCHARGED. PACKAGE CONTAINED AND BROUGHT OUTSIDE FOR INSPECTION. TWO FIRE EXTINGUISHERS IN PACKAGE MATCHING INVOICE. ABC FIRE EXTINGUISHER HAD PREVIOUSLY RELEASED PRESSURE AND FIRE RETARDENT POWDER.

item.title: Report E-2022120653
item.description:
Report E-2022120653

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-25T21:08:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-05
  • City: GREENLAND
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 05, 2022, Landstar Ranger reported that three (3) quarts of UN1805 Phosphoric Acid Solution was released to the trailer floor. Green Site Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 8ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor. The container was not available for inspection as the unit was unloaded prior to the contractor's arrival. Green Site Service personnel neutralized the trailer floor with a soda ash and water solution. One (1) 55-gallon poly drum was generated containing the spent neutralizer and absorbents. The waste was transported offsite for disposal by Green Site Service.

item.title: Report X-2022090315
item.description:
Report X-2022090315

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-25T21:08:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-10
  • City: LONDONDERRY
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package placed on a damage pallet at the qa cage. upon inspection it was noticed that all the cans were dented. one was dented so bad it caused a puncture hole in the bottom corner which caused the leakage DescribePack: box looked like it was improperly handled at some point from unload from the trailer to load point on truck. all cans dented on bottoms DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: outer box seemed to soak up the majority (mostly all) of spillage

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered on trailer #807967; it leaked on four other packages. package was given to QA after event had occurred. DescribePack: An entire side (vertical) of the box was completely soaked and torn. Package appeared to be leaking internally from a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in HAZMAT tote and brought to QA. No liquid was spilled on the trailer floor; all was contained on the cardboard boxes the liquid spilled on.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: OUTER PACKAGING WAS IDENTIFIED AS WET FROM A POSSIBLE LEAK ON LOADING BELT TWO DURING PRELOAD. SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND CERTIFIED RESPONDER ISOLATED THAT PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TUB. CONTENTS WERE IDNETIFIED TO MATCH MARKINGS ON CARTON AND THAT NO MORE LIQUID WAS ACTIVELY LEAKING FROM CRACKED GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES.

THE GALLON JUG'S CAP WAS LOOSE AND THERE WAS NO INNER SEAL. THERE WAS NO OTHER SIGNS OF DAMAGE ON INNER OR OUTER CARTON. ONE DAMAGED TOTAL. ONE SALVAGED.

THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-18
  • City: MANCHESTER
  • State: NH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 18, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of sulfuric acid was punctured by a forklift and released its contents to the trailer interior and concrete loading dock. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from US Ecology (USE) to perform the necessary corrective action. USE personnel overpacked the damaged drum, then utilized neutralizing agent and absorbents to remediate the impacted surfaces.
